Read the writing task and look carefully at the bar chart. Complete the report by putting the correct word, phrase or number into each gap.
Writing Task 1

section.p: The bar chart shows the amount of time that [1]-year-olds in England spend per week on sport and exercise. It is clear from the chart that [2] are less active in their leisure time than [3].

There is a striking difference between the percentages of men and women who prefer not to participate in sport in their free time. Almost [4] of young women devote no time at all to active leisure pursuits while this applies to only about [5] of young men. There is a similar difference between the percentages of very active young people. Almost [6] men between the ages of 16 and 24 play sport for [7] or more hours a week. The figure for young women is only [8].

A closer examination of the figures for young people who actually play sport reveals that the greatest proportion dedicate between [9] hours per week to these pastimes. This is true for just over [10] of both men and women.
The fact that only [11] of young women spend an hour or more a week on sport, compared to approximately [12] of young men, raises questions about how fit young women are in comparison to young men.
